The 'River Trent' is one of the major rivers of England. Its source is in
Staffordshire on the southern edge of Biddulph Moor. It flows through the
Midlands (forming a once significant boundary between the north and south of
England) until it joins the River Ouse at Trent Falls to form the Humber
Estuary, which empties into the North Sea below Hull and Immingham.

The Trent is unusual amongst English rivers in that it flows north (for the
second half of its route), and in exhibiting a tidal bore, the "Trent Aegir".
The area drained by the river includes most of the northern Midlands.
